posts.title: Flatten nested arrays of integers
posts.excerpt: Write some code, that will flatten an array of arbitrarily nested arrays of integers into a flat array of integers.example:flatten([[1, 2, [3]], 4]);// [1, 2, 3, 4]
posts.text: Write some code, that will flatten an array of arbitrarily nested arrays of integers into a flat array of integers.example:flatten([[1, 2, [3]], 4]);// [1, 2, 3, 4]

posts.title: Merging 2 packages
posts.excerpt: Given a package with a weight limit and an array of item weights, how can you most efficiently find two items with sum of weights that equals the weight limit?Your function should return 2 such indices of item weights or -1 if such pair doesn’t exist. What is the runtime and space complexity of your solution?example:findComplementingWeights([2, 4, 8, 14], 12);// [1, 2] or [2, 1]
posts.text: Given a package with a weight limit and an array of item weights, how can you most efficiently find two items with sum of weights that equals the weight limit?Your function should return 2 such indices of item weights or -1 if such pair doesn’t exist. What is the runtime and space complexity of your solution?example:findComplementingWeights([2, 4, 8, 14], 12);// [1, 2] or [2, 1]

posts.title: String reverse
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return a reversed string for given stringexample:reverse('you are a nice dude');// "edud ecin a era uoy"
posts.text: Write a function to return a reversed string for given stringexample:reverse('you are a nice dude');// "edud ecin a era uoy"

posts.title: Swap number without temp
posts.excerpt: Write a function to swap two numbers without an additional variableexample:swapNumb(2, 3);// before swap: a:2 b:3// after swap: a:3 b:2
posts.text: Write a function to swap two numbers without an additional variableexample:swapNumb(2, 3);// before swap: a:2 b:3// after swap: a:3 b:2

posts.title: Find point
posts.excerpt: Given two points P and Q, output the symmetric point of point P about Q
posts.text: Given two points P and Q, output the symmetric point of point P about Q

posts.title: Merge two sorted arrays
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return an array that two arrays are merged inexample:mergeSortedArray([2, 5, 6, 9], [1, 2, 3, 29]);// [1, 2, 2, 3, 5, 6, 9, 29]
posts.text: Write a function to return an array that two arrays are merged inexample:mergeSortedArray([2, 5, 6, 9], [1, 2, 3, 29]);// [1, 2, 2, 3, 5, 6, 9, 29]

posts.title: Remove Duplicate
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return an array that duplicate primitive values are removed inexample:removeDuplicate([1, 3, 3, 3, 1, 5, 6, 7, 8, 1]);// [1, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8]
posts.text: Write a function to return an array that duplicate primitive values are removed inexample:removeDuplicate([1, 3, 3, 3, 1, 5, 6, 7, 8, 1]);// [1, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8]

posts.title: Greatest Common Divisor
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return GCD(Greatest Common Divisor) of two numbersexample:greatestCommonDivisor(14, 21);// 7;greatestCommonDivisor(69, 169);// 1;
posts.text: Write a function to return GCD(Greatest Common Divisor) of two numbersexample:greatestCommonDivisor(14, 21);// 7;greatestCommonDivisor(69, 169);// 1;

posts.title: Fibonacci Number
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return the nth Fibonacci numberexample:fibonacci(0);// 1fibonacci(1);// 1fibonacci(2);// 2fibonacci(3);// 3fibonacci(4);// 5//// 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21, ···
posts.text: Write a function to return the nth Fibonacci numberexample:fibonacci(0);// 1fibonacci(1);// 1fibonacci(2);// 2fibonacci(3);// 3fibonacci(4);// 5//// 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21, ···

posts.title: Prime factors
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return an array for prime factors of a numberexample:primeFactors(69);// [3, 23]
posts.text: Write a function to return an array for prime factors of a numberexample:primeFactors(69);// [3, 23]

posts.title: Is a prime number
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return boolean for checking if it is a prime number.
posts.text: Write a function to return boolean for checking if it is a prime number.

posts.title: Reorder an array with given indexes
posts.excerpt: We have an array of objects A and an array of indexes B. Reorder objects in array A with given indexes in array B. Do not change array A’s length.example:var A = [C, D, E, F, G];var B = [3, 0, 4, 1, 2];sort(A, B);// A is now [D, F, G, C, E];
posts.text: We have an array of objects A and an array of indexes B. Reorder objects in array A with given indexes in array B. Do not change array A’s length.example:var A = [C, D, E, F, G];var B = [3, 0, 4, 1, 2];sort(A, B);// A is now [D, F, G, C, E];

posts.title: Pascal's triangle
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return the nth row in Pascal’s triangleFor example,getRow(1) returns 1getRow(2) returns 1 1getRow(3) returns 1 2 1getRow(4) returns 1 3 3 1
posts.text: Write a function to return the nth row in Pascal’s triangleFor example,getRow(1) returns 1getRow(2) returns 1 1getRow(3) returns 1 2 1getRow(4) returns 1 3 3 1

posts.title: The First Post
posts.text: My very first post The repository for this blog Quick StartClone$ git clone https://github.com/narr/blog.git Install$ npm install Run development server$ npm run server Open a browser on localhost:8080 Deploy to Github$ npm run deploy Ref. hexo hexo-theme-icarus
